description: Number of ways n-th repdigit number (A010785[ n ]) can be expressed as a polygonal number.
links: M. Keith, On Repdigit Polygonal Numbers, J. Integer Sequences, Vol. 1, 1998, #6.
example: The n-th k-sided polygonal number is P(n,k)=n((k-2)n+4-k)/2 (k >= 2, n >= 1). For each repdigit number R>=2, sequence gives number of (n,k) such that P(n,k)=R.
author: Mike Keith (domnei(AT)aol.com)
